My Tournament Monster
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): My Tournament Monster
By torey_luvullo on Saturday, February 16, 2002 - 06:15 pm:

if i did it right, fenrick now has in slot 1 a colorpandora named "cc" [in honor of the first cloned kitten]. he turned out pretty good, so i thought i would tell you how i did it.

first, the reason i chose colorpandora/kalaragi [i think of it as the "pure" because it is the one named colorpandora] is because it likes vine grass 2 blocks at all times. this means, no matter what else happens, i always have at least a 2/4 food at my disposal, and i never have to worry about him getting fat either.

i started training in kalaragi, and only doing the lif drill [the top drill]. i did this for 6 months, then moved to goat, and added the drill that gains pow but loses int [dont recall the name; its the 2d on the list] for 3 months. i then entered e tourney and won, and immediately gave him my best heart - luka's 3740 composite heart, with 800 -999 in all categories except int [which was 1]. i continued to train him in the +pow/-int drill until the next tourney, and then entered and won d level.

by the time of first growth, i had gotten into a groove [or fallen into a rut - you decide] i alternated feeding nuts, either stem mushrooms or hogsam peach, and vine grass...4/4, 4/4, 2/4. i did this the rest of his life - the pattern stayed true. by now, i was able to add blowfish [++spd/+pow/--int] to the rotation of drills. blowfish, hole, and the +pow/-int drill as needed, and as tolerated. once he got to 950+ in pow and spd, i moved him to brillia and started doing avalanch [+def/-int] for the rest of his life, until the last few months, when i moved him to morx.

i only fought in one other tourney his whole life - he died at b level. he started with 2 techs - swing and pinball, and got gogogo when he got luka's heart. in year 3, i got him the flare stone and he learned thundader.

the only special thing i did was to go to the light of earth venture either seems healthy or seems a little tired. then, i reset in light of earth time until he got an item that made him refreshed or very refreshed. then he came back healthy or full of energy, and i got extra drills in.

he started out "nice", but lost that after first growth, and became normal. maybe it was the additional stress or lack of rest, but when he hit prime, he developed a scrolling box "bad/unfriendly" and kept this for the rest of his life. it didnt seem to affect his statgain; he never failed from 6 mos until about 4 months left to live...a very steady monster, that cp breed.

he found 2 accessories - beetle jaws[3] in goat, and buterfly wings[3] in brillia. acc'd to the prima guide, neither of them does anything. selfishly, the guy to the far left took and wore them both; the other 2 cp units stayed unaccessorized.

here is the result:
lifpowintspddef
99999710997994


techs -pinball[lvl 1], swing[lvl 4/max], gogogo[lvl 2], and thundader[lvl 6]. magic secrets, intuitive, resists cold, resists heat. thin. battle sense = E [!!!].

its a long post, but i hope it provides some insight.

By Dreiz on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 10:43 am:

By Tigerbubble on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 11:16 am:

Thats really nice, my monster's never do so well, despite all the training methods i have tried. I have a question though, how did you get such a good heart to give to cc, could you tell us the ancestory? I have never been able to max out more than 2 stats, usually spd and pow, and around 700 lif, 300 def, and 1-200 int. But my monsters seem to do pretty well at winning tourneys, and i usuall have two level 10 techs maxed. My most common method consists of getting a jade stone, teaching a tech to the monster on its first venture, then giving it a monster heart that maxes out the jade stone tech. then i only fight in festas to move up the ranks. I avoid all un-needed fights and tourneys. once my monster reaches rank s, i train it until it reaches its last growth and becomes elderly, at which point i put it in hibernation and only fight it in the big 5 tourneys.

By torey_luvullo on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 12:06 pm:

i gave him the heart of luka the jell. composite 3740. for a long time i was stuck on about 3500, which meant two stats maxed, one almost maxed, and another at 500-700. 2 "methods" enabled me to reach this level...1] the psych0midget et al method of relentlessly allowing one stat to reach 1, then only using drills that reduced that stat during prime; 2] the digmoshmogi inspired idea of resetting during ventures until you get a refreshing item.

with luka, i did #2 kind of halfheartedly, and even that allowed me to climb above my previous plateau. with cc, i did it relentlessly... i made sure that i went to light of earth time "seems healthy" or worse. then i refused to accept any venture result that did not include something that made him "refreshed" or "very refreshed". that gained me another 250 pts to the composite.

i only fought in childhood...with a non-tourney monster, i would have fought my way to s level in old age, but i wanted to wring out every last point of stats for cc. i almost never hibernate...i realize that hibernation is a big part of the dmm method, in its fullest sense, but it still seems like a lot of trouble to me. oh well - maybe next monster.

By Excaliber21 on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 12:14 pm:

Great monster Torey! I didn't see it posted anywhere, but how long did cc live? I'm wondering if the digmoshmogi method you used made cc loose any extra lifespan b/c of excess stress after the ventures.

By torey_luvullo on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 12:21 pm:

thanx excaliber! forgot to mention, cc lived 4 yrs 7 mos. his first year was rough - besides the fighting, he also got stressed twice when i ued the dmm reset idea - i might want to hold off on that until maturity next time. so he lived 1 yr 1 mo before first growth, then every stage after that was 1 yr 2 mos. lisa's lifespan chart lists 5 yrs 1 mo as the cp max; so besides the month during childhood, i lost another 5 somewhere along the way...2 weeks out of those 20 were battles; so the other 18 is up for grabs - it might be the dmm, or it might be some other factor at work.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 02:14 pm:

His stats are 568/412/803/999/366. (I would have ignored Pow entirely, but Jokers don't have a close Int tech, and i was afraid to enter him with only far & medium techs.)

Anyway, with all my experiemnts on lifespans, and helping out with techs, and more (like playing MRA and working on that section), I just have not focused on hardcore ranching in MR3. I hope everyone has fun at least watching the tourney, and maybe I can do better in a later event.

By paladin on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 05:18 pm:

Nice name. "CC" From the cloned cat as you said. Just curious, what was his max damage in battle?

By torey luvullo on Sunday, February 17, 2002 - 05:35 pm:

against an int monster, he will 999 them if he uses thundader. against a good pow monster, it is a lot less. swing can be as little as 100 damage or as much as 300.

cc can take a hit - the strongest techs against him fail to take him out - int techs do more damage, but never enough to one-hit ko him. again, the best power techs can only do about 250-300 damage against him.
